heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 24 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (187°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 358 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 4.7°C), cloud levels (up 522 m), dew point temperature (up 3.2°C), and outside temperature (up 4.4°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 358.2m lower than yesterday, 153.2m lower than the past week, 521.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 794m to a maximum of 2000m, averaging 839.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 992.2m and 1360.8m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be low, possibly causing overcast or foggy conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and winds will be practically absent. Chance of light rain, cloud cover will be low, possibly causing overcast or foggy conditions, and it’s dim outside. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
